titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the French Postcard Collection, approximately 1880-1930
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Mark Seidl

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Mark Seidl April 2020

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Postcards depicting scenes of Paris, cathedrals and chateaux throughout France; images of artworks and of historical and literary figures.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of postcards collected, between approximately 1880 and 1930, by the French Department of Vassar College for use in teaching. The postcards depict scenes of Paris, cathedrals and chateaux throughout France, as well as artworks and of historical and literary figures.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Transfer from French and Francophone Studies Department (M2011-037).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: French Postcard Collection, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.

dsc.head: Container List
dsc.p: There is no container list currently available for this collection.
